response.answer_text: Egyptians were and are a mix of indigenous North Africans and Middle Eastern people. The first modern Egyptians were Cro-Magnon dated 30 000 years The inner ear of Nazlet Khater 2 (Upper Paleolithic, Egypt). About 6000 years ago, the Middle Eastern Farmers came into Egypt. Their remains are found throughout Egypt, but especially in Lower Egypt. Prehistoric Egypt - Wikipedia DNA taken from Egyptian mummies dated 1380 BC shows they were Middle Eastern in origin going back to the Middle Eastern Farmers: Egyptian mummy DNA study suggests close ties with Near East, Europe Upper Egyptians were mostly indigenous North Africans resembling Berbers and North African Bedouin Badari culture - Wikipedia Modern Egyptians originated from the above people and carry Sub-African DNA from recent slavery and migrations of Black Africans in recent times.
